title: Skin A 10G Cream
details: This cream is used for the treatment of acne, pimples, and other skin-related problems. It is also used when pores are clogged due to issues with hair follicles or when dirt enters into the pores leaving blackheads and dull-looking skin.UsesThis med READ MORE
precautions: When using this medication, you are at risk of getting sunburned or photodamaged. Stay out of the sun as much as possible.Tanning booths and sunlamps should be avoided at all costs. High winds or cold temperatures may also irritate the skin. You should use sunscreen and proper clothing when spending time in the sun.Likewise, you should tell your doctor or caregiver immediately if you experience skin blisters or sunburn occurs. Let your skin be the baby's burned, and then use Retin-A.While you are using this product, avoid electro-logy, waxing, and depilatory chemicals for hair removal.In case you have used products that contain resorcinol or salicylic acid, apply Sulphur emulsion or salicylic acid with caution. Before applying such products, wait until they have diminished (time has elapsed).WarningMedication should not be applied on an uncovered area, and the open area should be left uncovered until the doctor instructs otherwise.Only use a small amount of it because it won't have an effect and may make the skin condition worseTell your doctor or dentist before having surgery about all the products you use (including prescription drugs, nonprescription drugs, and herbal products).When it is clear that the medication is needed, use it during pregnancy. Before talking to your doctor, be aware of the potential benefits and risks.Before using tretinoin, tell your doctor or pharmacist if you are allergic to it; or to vitamin A-related drugs (other retinoids such as isotretinoin); or if you have any other allergies. This product may contain inactive ingredients (such as fish proteins), which can cause allergic reactions or other problems. Talk to your pharmacist for more details. During the first few weeks of using tretinoin, your acne might appear worse because the medication is working on pimples forming inside the skin. It may take up to 8-12 weeks to notice results from this medication. This medication may make you more sensitive to the sun. Limit your time in the sun. Avoid tanning booths and sunlamps. Weather extremes such as wind or cold may also be irritating to the skin. Use sunscreen daily and wear protective clothing when outdoors. Tell your doctor right away if you get sunburned or have skin blisters/redness. Wait until your skin has completely recovered from a sunburn before using tretinoin. This drug may pose risks to your pregnancy, therefore please do not take this medicine without consulting your doctor first. Ask your dermatologist before using it.
effects: Following are some side effects that might happen after using this cream. If they become worse or you notice an increase in your problem, tell your doctor soon.These skin issues may include skin irritation, redness, and itching. Tell your doctor or pharmacist if any of these effects persist or worsen.Loosening of skin when applying this medication.Unexpected hair growing.A very serious skin allergy from this cream is rare, but it mostly depends on one's medical condition, but still, one should consult medical help if one of these allergies show up.Swelling on the applied area.Itchy feel on the skin.Having trouble while breathingThe use of this medication over an extended period of time may lead to the development of skin infections other than those for which it was prescribed (such as fungal or other bacterial infections). If you notice any unusual skin symptoms or if your condition does not improve, be sure to contact your doctor.A brief sensation of warmth or stinging may occur immediately after applying the medication. Skin redness, dryness, itching, scaling, mild burning, or worsening of acne may occur during the first 2-4 weeks of using the medication. These effects usually decrease with continued use. A daytime moisturizer may be helpful for excessive dry skin

precautions: Skinoren cream precautions mainly include the age frame of people using this cream because it is always recommended according to the prescription of the doctor and the dose adjustment is also dependent on the age factor.Although there is no such target study available for the age group of the people but people suffering from renal impairment should always try not to use this cream because it cannot be effective for them.It is strictly advising not to use this screen around the areas of the eyes and mouth because if the eye irritation continues, then people should directly consult with the physicians.There is also no such availability of study regarding pregnant women, but it is advised by the doctors to not use this cream in this medical condition because of the lack of the availability of study and research.Before using this medication, tell your doctor or pharmacist if you are allergic to it; or if you have any other allergies. This product may contain inactive ingredients, which can cause allergic reactions or other problems. Talk to your pharmacist for more details. Do not use large amounts of this medication or apply it more often than directed. Your condition will not improve any faster, and the risk of side effects may increase.Use this medication for the full course of treatment as directed by your doctor. It usually takes about 1 month to see an improvement, but the full effects of treatment may take longer. Avoid contact in or near the eyes or inside the nose and mouth. If this medication gets into any of these areas, wash right away with plenty of water and call your doctor if irritation persists. Do not place a bandage or cover over the cream unless your doctor tells you to do so.
effects: One of the most frequently asked question is about Skinoren cream side effects because there is no doubt about the fact that this cream is extremely effective for the treatment of skin, but at the same time, there are some serious symptoms and side effects of using this cream which should always be dealt with extreme care and attention.Some of the Skinoren cream side effects are given belowThis medicine should not be used, especially for those who are suffering from in problems, because the irritation of the skin is considered as one of the biggest symptoms of using this cream.All those people suffering from allergic reactions should always try not to use this medicine because, in the long run, it can cause some serious allergic reactions.It is always safer not to use this cream for children's and old age people because their skin might not be able to resist against Skinoren cream.Temporary stinging, burning, itching, or tingling of the skin may occur, usually at the beginning of treatment. These effects usually lessen as your body adjusts to this medication. However, if minor irritation continues, your doctor may instruct you to only use this product once daily. If any of these effects persist or worsen, stop using this medication and tell your doctor or pharmacist promptly.

title: Arynion 10G Gel
details: It is use to treat acne
precautions: Tell your doctor/Pharmacist your medical history, especially of Kidney disease, Liver disease, a certain type of Muscle disease (Myasthenia gravis).
effects: This medication may cause Burning, Redness, Itching, or Dry/Peeling/Oily skin.

title: Acne-Lene 15G Gel
details: This medication is used to treat acne. It may decrease the number and severity of acne pimples and promote quick healing of pimples that do develop. Adapalene belongs to a class of medications called retinoids. It works by affecting the growth of ce READ MORE
precautions: Before using adapalene, tell your doctor or pharmacist if you are allergic to it; or to vitamin A-related drugs (other retinoids such as isotretinoin); or if you have any other allergies. This product may contain inactive ingredients, which can cause allergic reactions or other problems. Talk to your pharmacist for more details. This medication may make you more sensitive to the sun. Limit your time in the sun. Avoid tanning booths and sunlamps. Weather extremes such as wind or cold may also be irritating to the skin. Use sunscreen daily and wear protective clothing when outdoors. Tell your doctor right away if you get sunburned or have skin blisters/redness. Wait until your skin has completely recovered from a sunburn before using adapalene.
effects: This medication may cause mild, temporary burning or stinging when you apply it. If either of these effects persists or worsens, tell your doctor or pharmacist promptly.

title: Movelat 50G Gel
details:
Movelat gel is an analgesic with the generic name of mucopolysaccharide poly-sulfate. It is a methyl salicylate topical used for inflammation and muscle pain. To understand what is movelat gel used for, read the full article.

Ingredients:<
READ MORE
precautions: The necessary movelat gel preventive measures are described below to avoid possible side effects.Do not use the movelat gel if you have experienced allergy or hypersensitivity from it, as the gel contains some inactive ingredients.Inform your doctor of your medical history and previous allergies.Notify your doctor of all the medication and supplements you are using.Inform your doctor if you experience any of the following conditions:If the signs of pain or illness get worse or do not improve.If you are pregnant.If you are breastfeeding, the medication can pass into breast milk. So, inform your doctor before using the gel.If you have a history of or pre-existing liver disorder.If you have a history of or pre-existing kidney disorder.If you are taking any other prescribed or non-prescribed medicines.If you are hypersensitive to mucopolysaccharide polysulfate, salicylic acid, or non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drugs.If you have an infected skin condition or eczema.Do not apply to large areas of skin.Do not apply to sensitive areas such as the mouth, eyes, or genitals.The gel can cause discomfort on sensitive skin. Please inform your doctor and try to use it after a bath.It is recommended to wash the hands immediately after using the gel.Stop using movelat gel and inform your doctor if you experience allergy or irritation.Avoid smoking or going near flames as you might get severe burns.Keep the medication away from the reach of children.Keep the movelat gel in a safe and dry place.Tell your doctor/Pharmacist if you are Allergic to methyl salicylate; or to aspirin or other salicylates, asthma, Nasal polyps.
effects: The possible movelat gel side effects are listed below. Inform your doctor if they get worsen or prolonged.Redness at the infected site.Burning sensation at the infected site.Rashes at the infected site.Pain at the infected area.

title: Duac 15G Gel
details:
Duac gel belongs to the family of anti-inflammatory ointments, that works by stopping the growth of bacteria. This ointment is used to treat certain types of acne. Its generic name is Clindamycin-Benzoyl Peroxide.Â 

Uses

Duac ge

READ MORE
precautions: Inform the dermatologist of your complete medical history and allergies before using this ointment.Also, inform the doctor if you are allergic to any of the ingredients present in this medicine.Do not use this medication if you have an ulcer or any other intestinal disorder.Do not expose bare skin to the sun after applying this ointment.It may make your skin sensitive to the sun.Pregnant women should only use this ointment in case of seriousÂ conditions.Breastfeeding mothers should avoid using the medication as it may pass into the milk in smallÂ amounts.Keep the medicine away from sunlight.Keep it away from children's reach.Store it under 25oC andÂ in a dry place.
effects: The most common side-effects of duac Gel that may appear for only 1 or 2 days are as follows. These side-effects go on their own and do not require any medical assistance.Â Skin DrynessMild rednessItchiness and burningPeeling of skin.Rare side-effectsThe side effects listed below are very rare and may appear in people allergic to any of the ingredients present in the medicine. In case, any of these side effects appear immediately, seek medical assistance. Rare side-effects of the use of this ointment are as follows:Severe burning of the skinIrritable Bowel SyndromeThe appearance of rashes on the treated area.Skin becomes sensitiveErythemaSwelling on the face or feetShortness of breath due to the allergic reaction to any of theÂ ingredients.The tightness of the Throat.Yellowing of eyes and skinFluid around the eyesEye DiscomfortBloody Stool in very rare cases.Unbearable abdominal pain
